content.label: This game is an absolute beauty. I love the look and play style. I‚Äôve had this game for years and love playing it on my free time at work. The only thing I wish was different, is if you could customize the character. Such as getting so far or completing challenges you get new armor or weapon skins permanently where after each death and start of a new round/game, you‚Äôd still have that armor set or weapon that appeals to you.  I fell like customization of the character would really top the cake on this one. Other than that, the game is almost flawless/perfect.
Been playing this game for years. Excellent! Thanks for updating!

title.label: Fantastic game, thanks for the update!

content.label: Well worth the download!

title.label: Best money I‚Äôve spent in the all store

content.label: Thanks for the update! I still play this home years later. Fun and entertaining, especially during flights

Although I stopped playing games that didn‚Äôt have widescreen support, I couldn‚Äôt bear to delete this one so it languished in my ‚ÄúPurgatory‚Äù folder with a (very) few other gems from yesteryear. But no more! I have moved it out of my folder of exile and placed it back on page 2 with the rest of my mostest favoritest games EVAR!

Look on his works, ye mighty, and despair!

I‚Äôve played this game off and on for 4 years.  Many long droughts during that period, but this is one of the few games that I‚Äôve never deleted from my iPhone.  Roguelike nature, simple and fair mechanics, plays well on small devices (iPhone 5S).  Love it, just wish there was more like it.

title.label: One of the best mobile games I‚Äôve ever played

content.label: Perfect combination of strategy, simplicity, and replayability.

Easy to learn but very challenging. Lots of fun even when you lose. Works great on an XS Max. I really like that you can close the app at any time and it saves, so you can play in short spurts and pick it up again later. That‚Äôs great for busy people. Great job, and I appreciate a fair price with no IAP!

title.label: One of my all time favorites!

content.label: This is a simple game with deep strategy. I‚Äôm a huge fan of this game! I‚Äôd love more games like this.
Fantastic, elegant design. The game‚Äôs challenge modes have me returning to the game for years now.
Simple, strategic, hexagonal, turn-based goodness.
This game is really good! Love the gesture controls and roguelike structure. üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü
Simple, fun, addictive, and surprisingly deep. Possibly my favorite iDevice game of all time.

title.label: Perfect game that needs iPhone X support

content.label: Love this game, originally found it when I was using an Android and recently moved to iPhone. If this had support for modern iPhones it would be a 10/10 best game available.

title.label: 3 years later - this is the only game I play

content.label: I‚Äôve been looking for A replacement, but I have yet to find anything that combines the simplicity, strategy, portrait mode, and straight up goodness of this game
This is everything you want in mobile entertainment.
Love the game, but it doesn‚Äôt open anymore since the latest update. Crashes on launch.
Too short. Please make a followup.
I‚Äôve had this game for years now and it‚Äôs still fun to open up every so often.

I really love this little game. I wish there were more like it. The daily quest is a great addition to a rock solid game. This game is simple, but elegant and endlessly rewarding. If you like chess, you might just love this game enough to play all the time like I do.
Great if you like roguelikes in the simplest way possible
I‚Äôve played and loved this game for years now. Anything the developer makes will be a must-buy for me!

title.label: Awesome game, but bugged since last update.

content.label: I play this all the time when I‚Äôm bored and looking for a challenge. A constant on my phone for over 2 years.
strategy game.

still updating, and recently the change back to not muting my podcasts or music while playing the game spurred me to review.  gameplay is deceptively simple, but strategy is inherent and going for achievements can widen the range of your ability possibilities, a challenging progression scheme.  highly recommended!
So glad they fixed music being muted while playing! Now I‚Äôll play this a lot more thanks!
I‚Äôve been playing this since it came out 4 years ago. It‚Äôs still great.

Many games have come and gone on my phone over the years, but Hoplite remains forever. I sometimes will go months without playing it, but I inevitably come back to it and get re-addicted every time. My personal record is floor 73 and I've unlocked every achievement. This game is close to perfect.

title.label: a great game, but let me listen to my music!

content.label: this is one of my favorite ios games of all time, but i can't listen to podcasts or music while playing, which is supremely disappointing. please fix this!
So well designed and so balanced. And really fun to play and master. Only iPhone game to date to make it to my home screen.

... It commits a cardinal sin, it stops my music from playing. It's my device, I pick the music. 

If it doesn't bother you that starting the game cuts off a great song them this a great game. For me that's an instant 1 üåü review. 

I'll be happy to change this 5 üåü if the author will fix this bug.
One of the best sequential, asymmetrical, perfect information games of all time.
Excellent mechanics and the achievements give you a lot of difficult goals to accomplish.
This is just a great all around game. Looks, controls, challenging. As many times as I clean up my apps this one will never get deleted.

If you have some time to spare getting good at this game is a lot of fun. It has a steep learning curve and has almost infinite replay ability due to its multiple powers and daily challenges. My one complaint is that it is really hard to do a run without killing anybody since they sometimes kill each other.

title.label: Pretty much exactly what I want

content.label: This is by far the best game on the App Store. Cavern is similar but not quite as fun.

title.label: Truly amazing reinvention of mobile rogue

content.label: Hoplite reinvents the classic rogue like for an almost perfect mobile gaming experience. Nothing besides 868-HACK comes close.
Don't look like much, but it's got the goods for sure. Surprisingly addictive.

This is a pretty solid turn-based game. It will take you time to get good at it, which can be discouraging at first, but once you get the hang of it you'll start to like it better. It's not a perfect strategy game, but it does what it does pretty well. 

Also, it has a fun challenge of the day mode that is shorter than the normal game where you start off with different varieties of power ups. This feature kind of saves the game for me, to be honest, as the longer game can take a good chunk of your time to get through. About 20-30 mins. Plus, it's kind of annoying to have to start off for the very beginning every time.

This game is brilliant fun, but there is a crashing issue that has popped up for me recently and  persisted even after reinstalling the app. I am on ios8 and iPhone 6. Be careful but if it works it's a great game to pull out for 2 turns or for 1/2 an hour.

When this was a featured in an article on Bloomberg under "Best one handed games to play on your commute" - I was intrigued. 

A game for adults that is featured on Bloomberg?

And am I glad I bought it!
It is a dungeon crawler and as you clear every level you have a choice to keep adding special abilities. 

The gameplay is fun and special powers keep the replay value.

Don't let the basic graphics fool you. It is the ideal game for a quick 7 minute break before the conference call starts, or for an "after lunch" break before you head to your trading terminals. 

MUST BUY!!
I didn't know what "rogue-like game" meant when I first played, but I can't find one now that compares to Hoplite. Fun the first time, and I've come back time and time again to replay

I don't buy a lot of games and I can't remember the last time I rated a game, but this game is great. Easy to get into, quick, and super challenging. I get a little better each time I embark. This is the best game I've downloaded in a while, highly recommended.

Very good "bite-sized" strategy game. The scale of the game is not huge, and that's part of it's appeal. The simpler graphics are also a part of it's appeal ( retro and more modern). When you do end up getting the fleece you feel you've accomplished a good battle run. The added options of more life, more energy, longer jumps, etc. are a nice addition to your strategy plans ( bonus -- they are IAP free). Well done!
Time for an adjective dump: highly addictive,  strategic, fast-paced, turn-based roguelike dungeon crawler with surprising depth. I recommend turning on swipe controls.
Strategy, board game, turn-based, amazing little game. Well worth the money!!! And I love that there are no in-app purchases.
One of the best iPhone games out there. So satisfying.

title.label: Simple to learn, with engrossing gameplay

content.label:
I love this game! It's a turn-based dungeon battle. The rules are simple, but the game is randomized so that every game is different. You learn from every game, and it never gets old. Your game achievements actually unlock new possible skills! 

The legacy graphics option is fun too, don't miss that. 

Great fun, get it.

My only (minor) complaint, in case the developer is reading: I'd really like to see my health while I'm in the temple screen. It can be hard to remember how much damage I took in the last round.

I've taken to aborting games because the computer has me making moves I did NOT initiate. Everyone tests to see what the best move will be. Well, the computer arbitrarily decides to make one of those moves for real, literally as I press another spot. This game has been seeking an overhaul for some time. It's lure is weakening. Who can afford the time to play a whole game and then have the computer err on a crucial move? If I didn't trust programmers the way I do (unveiled sarcasm) I would think this is all a plot to give the computer an even larger edge.
Great strategy game
